result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby K Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**AMENDMENT 3-24-2022- Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect all restitution and court costs to be paid to the Department of Corrections.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT 
----------------------------------------------------------------
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,314.36 and restitution surcharges.  Restitution awarded to Walmart-Whitewater.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medication to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed. No contact with Walmart. No contact with co-defendants.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
*AMENDMENT 3-22-2022 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect 4 months jail without work release privileges. 

to commence forthwith. With work release privileges.
Jail time may be served in Rock County; electronic monitoring is allowed if defendant is found eligible.

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
Complete 50 hours of community service work for each year of probation ordered.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bobby K Morgan appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared in court for Bobby K Morgan. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 3. Upon Motion of the State count 2 is granted to be dismissed and read-in.Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives warning to deportation, firearm possession and voting ineligibility. Court inquires if Defendant wishes to make a statement, Defendant does not make a statement. Minutes filed.
PLEAS Reset Request

Defendant Bobby K Morgan in court, in custody by video with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Uzowulu, argument. Denied. Bond remains. State objects to any bond modification. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:08 PM (64-05) Defendant Bobby K Morgan in court, in custody with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bobby K Morgan appeared by video means.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
State is requesting 2 weeks for an Arraignment Hearing.

Motion to modify bond by Attorney Uzowulu.
State objects, requesting bond remain.
Argument by Attorney Uzowulu, requesting to reduce to $50.00 cash.
Court denies Motion to modify bond.
